page.title: 03SUPERNATURAL IN MOORSHOLM
page.content: The Quaker Meeting House, built in 1762 on the west side of the village, is the only site of any supernatural event in Moorsholm. The building was converted into two houses a long time ago. For many years after the conversion one of the neighbours, an old lady, would knock on the front door of the other to rouse her for Sunday service. The haunting manifests itself as knocking on the front door and windows of two houses (in one case at about the time for Sunday Service), opening and closing of doors - which will then jam shut. An apparition has been seen but of indistinct form. The new owner's dog refused to enter the building at first but has now settled in. The haunting appears to be friendly as no one has suffered ill effects. There are graves in the gardens of the houses.
